Description of what the funding was awar: Funding was awarded to support individuals in Oxford who feel isolated, lonely and marginalised through disabity, low income or heath problems.
Funding was awarded to support refugees and asylum seekers in Oxford.
funding was awarded to contribute towards the 2016 Festival of Nature
Funding was awarded to contribute towards the running of out of schools activities on Blackbird Leys
Funding was awarded for the Clockhouse Project - running activities for local residents over 50 years old
Funding was awarded to contribute towards the general running costs of the emergency food bank.
Funding awarded to contribute towards the costs of providing a 3 week summer play scheme for local children aged 4-11 years old on Cutteslowe
Funding awarded to support transport costs for the most vulnerable and access for disadvantaged individuals.

How the grant will be paid: 3 single payments (£4,000, £2,000 & £300) to organisation with £700 to Council for rent
Description of what the funding was awar: Funding was awarded to contribute towards the 1-2-1 support for children and young people who have been identified as at risk of social exclusion or offending. £700 was deducted from the grant to pay rent charges due to Oxford City Council for 2015/16.
Funding awarded to contribute towards their centre based school holiday play schemes.
funding awarded to contribute towards the cost of insurance for the 2 day Headington Summer Festival
Funding awarded to run a year long intensive mentoring programme targeting 12 'high risk' young people on Barton & Sandhills.
Funding awarded to contribute towards home tutoring for children and young people who have been identified as needing additional support.
Funding was awarded to contribute towards a weely drop in session for adult refugees and asylum seekers.
Funding was awarded to contribute towards management and admin costs to recruit more members of the public who have an empty room that could be offered free of use to asylum seekers or refugees.
Funding was awarded to contribute towards a play & activity day for families and children living in Cutteslowe.
Funding was awarded to contribute towards the costs of organising and planning the Elder Stubbs Festival due to take place on 20th August 2016.
Funding awarded to contribute towards room hire charges at Rose Hill community centre.
Funding was awarded to contribute towards the general running costs to provdie free supervised play during Easter & Summer school holidays.
Funding was awarded to run a community arts project in Wood Farm.
Funding was awarded to contribute towards providing a Wednesday youth club for young people living on Wood Farm.
